_header: But now I see even then
_description: Prayer for his mistress — one couplet

HunHM136.Transcription:
But now I se even then my mystrys dos me loveHer for to defende I be
                    seke the lorde above
HunHM136.Note:
Added to upper margin of folio in Brut Chronicle, by a hand of
                    the sixteenth century.
HunHM136.Editions:
Hanna,  Ralph,
                        ed.  
             “The Index of Middle English Verse and Huntington Library Collections: A
                Checklist of Addenda.” 
             Publications of the Bibliographical Society of America
         74 (1980): 235-58: 241.
